findings.title: SQL Injection vulnerability in user query
findings.description: Direct string concatenation in SQL query allows injection attacks. User input is not sanitized before query execution.
findings.snippet: const query = `SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ${userId}`;
findings.recommendation: Use parameterized queries: db.query('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?', [userId])
findings.impact: Potential data breach, unauthorized access to user records, data manipulation

cross_references.reason: Same file flagged in multiple dimensions
